text.name: hlmgui_speedControlMod
text.text: Use mod Speed Control/Extended Cruise Control

text.name: hlmgui_gpsAutoTriggerSubTitle
text.text: Current vehicle dimensions: Overall length: %2.2f m, Overall width: %2.2f m, Turning radius: %2.2f m

text.name: hlmgui_speedControlTT
text.text: On the headland, the cruise control setting can be changed to an adjustable value and then reset afterwards.

text.name: hlmgui_speedControlModTT
text.text: If available, the mod 'SpeedControl' can be used for adjusting cruise control.

text.name: hlmgui_speedSettingTT
text.text: Desired cruise control setting in the headland.

text.name: hlmgui_speedControlModSettingTT
text.text: Use cruise control 1, 2, or 3 on the headland.

text.name: hlmgui_alarmTT
text.text: When headland mode is activated, a regular warning tone is emitted.

text.name: hlmgui_inputbindingsTT
text.text: The respective active key assignments are displayed in the F1 menu

text.name: hlmgui_raiseTT
text.text: In the headland, lowered implements can be raised and then lowered again. Optionally adjustable for all, only front or only rear implements.

text.name: hlmgui_plowTT
text.text: After lifting, plows can be turned. Either completely, or initially only to the center, and afterwards completely while lowering. Note: In the latter case, good timing is important. It is therefore recommended to stop briefly at the end of the headland to turn and lower the plow.

text.name: hlmgui_ptoTT
text.text: At the headland, activated implements can be switched off and then switched on again. Optionally adjustable for all, only front or only rear implements.

text.name: hlmgui_contourOnOffTT
text.text: Activates control along the edge of the field, either for one lane only, or until it is switched off again. This function is only active in field mode, in headland mode it is on stand-by. With active contour guidance, it is recommended not to exceed a working speed of 10km/h.

text.name: hlmgui_contourSettingTT
text.text: Determines on which side the field border is to be followed. Here, the page can optionally be switched with each change to the headland mode, or it is retained.

text.name: hlmgui_contourWidthSettingTT
text.text: The distance to the field edge can either be maintained or it can be fixed.

text.name: hlmgui_contourWidthChangeSettingTT
text.text: If desired, the distance to the edge of the field can be widened by one vehicle width each time you switch to headland mode.

text.name: hlmgui_ridgeMarkerTT
text.text: While lifting, the ridgemarker can be switched to the opposite side.

text.name: hlmgui_emptyBalersSettingTT
text.text: Stops automatic unloading of balers in the headland

text.name: hlmgui_gpsTT
text.text: GPS tracking is paused at the headland and then resumed.

text.name: hlmgui_gpsTypeTT
text.text: The function can be limited to Guidance Steering or VCA, or automatically pause the currently active system.

text.name: hlmgui_gpsAutoTriggerTT
text.text: In conjunction with Guidance Steering, headland management can be activated automatically when the headland is reached.

text.name: hlmgui_gpsAutoTriggerOffsetTT
text.text: By default, headland management is activated when the front of the vehicle reaches the headland. This can be switched to the rear of the vehicle. Important: This function can only be switched if the track guidance of GS is not active!

text.name: hlmgui_gpsAutoTriggerOffsetWidthTT
text.text: Distance to the field edge from which the headland mode is to be activated

text.name: hlmgui_diffLockTT
text.text: At the headland, active differential locks are released and then set again.

text.name: hlmgui_csTT
text.text: When the headland is reached, an active crab steering can be switched over. Either directly, or first in normal or reversing position and then at the end of the headland completely.

text.name: hlmgui_VCADirSwitchTT
text.text: Enables or disables automatically switching of turn direction. Usefull when VCA has different numbers for skipping lanes left/right.

text.name: hlmgui_gpsAutoResumeTT
text.text: Switches back to field mode as soon as the vehicle has changed course by 180°.

text.name: hlmgui_debugTT
text.text: Displays a marker at the front and rear vehicle node

text.name: hlmgui_debugFlagTT
text.text: Displays two flags marking the destination trigger (green) and the vehicle trigger (red) in the 'first front, then rear' setting in headland mode
